title.native: アクティヴレイド 機動強襲室第八係 2
title.romaji: Active Raid: Kidou Kyoushuushitsu Dai Hakkei 2

description:
The nation's capital, Tokyo, where the Space Elevator Project is proceeding at full tilt, in preparation for the summit. Established to fight crime based around Willwear, enhanced armor, is the Special Public Security Fifth Division Third Mobile Assault Eighth Unit—Unit 8 in short. Having saved Japan from Logos' terrorism, Unit 8 was now become really popular around the country. However, crimes misusing Willwear showed no signs of slowing down. In fact, they kept escalating. Kuroki and the rest of Unit 8 now have new members on their side, and continue to fight evil crimes with their brains, bravery, and the gift of gab—now with the help of civilian police.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Tokusatsu
tags.description: Prominently features elements that resemble special effects in Japanese live-action shows

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

title.native: アクティヴレイド 機動強襲室第八係

node.description:
__Doujin Circle:__ Hikakuteki Simple na Panty (比較的シンプルなパンティ)

[Blog](http://tosh2367.blog108.fc2.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Syunsaeki) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/88701)

Was an assistant of [Tadahiro Miura](https://anilist.co/staff/111985).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/quarter_law) | [Profile](http://www.undecided.co.jp/profile.html) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%AD%E5%B7%9D%E5%B9%B8%E5%A4%AA%E9%83%8E)

Japanese composer and arranger. He graduated from Tokyo University of the Arts' school of music. He is the son of musician and trumpet player Yoshihiro Nakagawa and older brother of the trombonist [Eijirou Nakagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/271401/Eijirou-Nakagawa). He has done music for various anime, dramas, films, and tokusatsu shows.

Nakagawa is known for collaborating with director [Gorou Taniguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/98066/Gorou-Taniguchi), and has written and composed the scores for many of his projects since [s-CRY-ed](https://anilist.co/anime/168/sCRYed/) in 2001. Including the acclaimed [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Lelouch-of-the-Rebellion/) series. Outside anime, he is also noted for his work on many Super Sentai and Kamen Rider series.

**Notable works outside anime as composer:**
~!- Hyakujuu Sentai Gaoranger (tokusatsu, TV series, 2001)
- GoGo Sentai Boukenger (tokusatsu, TV series, 2006)
- Kamen Rider Decade (tokusatsu, TV series, 2009) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider W (tokusatsu, TV series, 2009-10) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider OOO (tokusatsu, TV series, 2010) 
- Kamen Rider Wizard (tokusatsu, TV series, 2012-13)
- Kamen Rider Drive (tokusatsu, TV series, 2014) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider Revice (tokusatsu, TV series, 2021)!~

Among [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s most noted directors.

Famous directorial works include [Planetes](https://anilist.co/anime/329/), [Scryed](https://anilist.co/anime/168/), [Infinite Ryvius](https://anilist.co/anime/593/) as well as [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/), which is an original story created by him and the series' lead writer [Ichirou Ookouchi](https://anilist.co/staff/98067/). Taniguchi is the one who proposed the idea to the producers at Sunrise. The basic idea for the plot consisted of a "hero" who led a secret organization, which was later developed into a conflict between two characters with different values and who belonged to the same military unit.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/荒川稔久)

Married to fellow scriptwriter [Hiroko Naka](https://anilist.co/staff/181820/).
Started off as a composite artist.
**Imai Mami (今井雅美)** is a Japanese animator and animation director.

__Agency:__ Apte Pro

[Profile (Apte Pro)](https://aptepro.jp/talents/y_aisaka.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yuuka_aisaka) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yuuka_aisaka/)

__Birth Place:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Website](http://tokisawanao.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Tokisawa_Nao)

__Agency:__ Apte Pro

[Profile (Apte Pro)](https://aptepro.jp/talents/y_aisaka.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yuuka_aisaka) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yuuka_aisaka/)

__Birth Place:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Website](http://tokisawanao.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Tokisawa_Nao)
A lyricist from Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan

__Agency:__ Mausu Promotion (2012-2021), Toho Entertainment (2021-)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/TomoyoKurosawa) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tomoyo_kurosawa_official_/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kurosawa-tomoyo/)

A Japanese actress, voice actress, and singer. Kurosawa began studying acting at the age of 3. In 2000, she began appearing in TV dramas, commercials and stage performances. At the age of 13, she made her voice acting debut as [Natsuki Koyama](https://anilist.co/character/30214/) in the 2010 anime film [Welcome to the Space Show](https://anilist.co/anime/8115/).

Kurosawa became a support member of Sound Horizon in 2008.

On June 8, 2023, her agency announced her marriage on Twitter.

__Awards:__
- Best Lead Actress at the 12th Seiyuu Awards in 2018 for her roles as [Phosphophyllite](https://anilist.co/character/123385/) and [Kumiko Oumae](https://anilist.co/character/88708/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Website](http://uchidamaaya.jp/) | [Profile](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=26) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/maaya_taso) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/uchidamaayataso/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJFEXIRB6DP_2FQJzv7pbXg)

Maaya Uchida is a Japanese actress, voice actress and singer who works for I'm Enterprise. She is [Yuuma Uchida](https://anilist.co/staff/119617/)'s older sister.

**Awards:**
- She won the Best New Actress Award at the 8th Seiyuu Awards, for her role as [Hajime Ichinose](https://anilist.co/character/85153/).

**Non anime roles:**
- [Fischl](https://anilist.co/character/209685/Fischl) - Genshin Impact (VG)
- [Ichihime](https://anilist.co/character/200348/Ichihime) - Mahjong Soul (VG)
- Pure Vanilla Cookie - Cookie Run: Kingdom (VG)
- Admi - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Epinel - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Ms. NewBabel - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
- Gretel - SINoAlice (VG)
- Sakura - Shinobi Nightmare (VG)
- Kanami - Strinova (VG)
- S-Sha - Megadimension Neptunia VII (VG)
- Zero - Drakengard 3 (VG)
- Hiroyo Hakase - Hikōnin Sentai Akibaranger (Super Sentai)

[Profile (I'm Enterprise)](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=31) | [Official Blog](https://ameblo.jp/ari-step/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ari_Ozawa) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B0%8F%E6%BE%A4%E4%BA%9C%E6%9D%8E)

On August 10th, 2020, she announced her marriage to musician [Hige Driver](https://anilist.co/staff/142137).

__Non-anime roles:__~!
• Akizuki, Nowaki, Prinz Eugen in "Kantai Collection" (VG)
• Anju in "Dream C Club Gogo." (VG/PS3)

• Xiangling in "Genshin Impact" (VG)

• Iochi Mari in "Blue Archive" (VG)

node.description:
[Profile](https://mausu.net/talent/okawa-toru.html) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tōru_Ōkawa) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大川透)

He is an actor, voice actor and narrator. He is currently affiliated with Mausu Promotion. He is a Hanshin Tigers fan. His "Kojirou" alias is not to be confused with [Akito Sakuragi](https://anilist.co/staff/125572)'s alias (they have different kanji at the end).

**Height:** 163cm

Akino Kawamitsu, better known by her stage name AKINO, is an American-born Japanese pop singer, from Utah. Originally debuting in 2003 with her brothers Akashi and Aiki and her sister Kanasa in the band bless4, Akino made her solo debut in 2005 singing the opening themes of the TV anime Sousei no Aquarion. Her debut album "Lost in Time" was released in 2007 under her new stage name, AKINO from bless4. All of her songs are composed by Yoko Kanno.

[Blog](https://ameblo.jp/grooving-myself/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/IKUObass190) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC6fpeeWqGcckLTmhR9XqqPw) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ikuo)

Japanese singer and bassist.

[Blog](https://ameblo.jp/grooving-myself/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/IKUObass190) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC6fpeeWqGcckLTmhR9XqqPw) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ikuo)

Japanese singer and bassist.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/荒川稔久)

Married to fellow scriptwriter [Hiroko Naka](https://anilist.co/staff/181820/).
